title: Huge chunk of meat
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Huge_chunk_of_meat/zh-CN "Huge chunk of meat/zh-CN")

| % [![Huge chunk of meat.png](/images/5/5d/Huge_chunk_of_meat.png)](/wiki/File:Huge_chunk_of_meat.png) |                                       |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                                                  | huge chunk of meat                    |
| Base price                                                                                            | 105 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")     |
| Nutrition                                                                                             | [2000](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")   |
| Turns to eat                                                                                          | 20                                    |
| Weight                                                                                                | [400](/wiki/Weight "Weight")          |
| Conduct                                                                                               | [meat](/wiki/Conduct#Vegan "Conduct") |

A **huge chunk of meat** is a type of [comestible](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible") item that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is [fleshy](/wiki/Fleshy "Fleshy") and not [vegetarian](/wiki/Vegetarian "Vegetarian") or vegan.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 85099512](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/85099512915a46dde1c813a3fbf56b151dd37fe1), the huge chunk of meat is renamed to the **enormous meatball**.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 Variants](#Variants)
  - [5.1 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

The huge chunk of meat is not randomly generated, and can only be created by zapping a [boulder](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder") with a spell of [stone to flesh](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh").

## Description

When [eaten](/wiki/Eaten "Eaten"), the huge chunk of meat provides the highest [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition") value of any comestible in the game at 2000.

## Strategy

The huge chunk of meat is the heaviest non-[corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") comestible at 400 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum"), and will likely make the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") [oversatiated](/wiki/Oversatiated "Oversatiated") unless they were fainting beforehand - beware eating ***anything*** while oversatiated, as the hero will very likely choke over their food and die, unless they are [breathless](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless") or wearing an [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving").

The huge gain in nutrition will keep a hero satiated for at least a few hundred turns, which [abuses](/wiki/Abuse "Abuse") [dexterity](/wiki/Dexterity "Dexterity") - this can be offset by a lot of [exercise](/wiki/Exercise "Exercise") or a means of restoring lowered stats, e.g. a non-cursed [potion of restore ability](/wiki/Potion_of_restore_ability "Potion of restore ability"). The nutrition should also last long enough for the hero to find some lighter sources of permafood, as well as providing a "buffer" for nutrition drain from any [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting"). [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer") in particular always start with the spell of stone to flesh, which can be cast more reliably once they gain some [experience levels](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") and allows them to keep well-fed while searching for permafood, so long as they can find boulders.

## History

The huge chunk of meat first appears in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0") along with the spell of stone to flesh.

## Variants

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), huge chunks of meat can be randomly generated, and can be sold in general [stores](/wiki/Store "Store") and delicatessens.

[Hunger hulks](/wiki/Hunger_hulk "Hunger hulk") leave behind huge chunks of meat rather than boulders while [tunneling](/wiki/Tunnel "Tunnel").

## Encyclopedia entry

- *See the [encyclopedia entry for meatball](/wiki/Meatball#Encyclopedia_entry "Meatball").*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Huge chunk of meat

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
%
Name huge chunk of meat
Base price 105 zm
Nutrition 2000
Turns to eat 20
Weight 400
Conduct meat

A huge chunk of meat is a type of comestible item that appears in NetHack. It is fleshy and not vegetarian or vegan.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Per commit 85099512, the huge chunk of meat is renamed to the enormous meatball.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SlashTHEM
  • 6 Encyclopedia entry

Generation

The huge chunk of meat is not randomly generated, and can only be created by zapping a boulder with a spell of stone to flesh.

Description

When eaten, the huge chunk of meat provides the highest nutrition value of any comestible in the game at 2000.

Strategy

The huge chunk of meat is the heaviest non-corpse comestible at 400 aum, and will likely make the hero oversatiated unless they were fainting beforehand - beware eating anything while oversatiated, as the hero will very likely choke over their food and die, unless they are breathless or wearing an amulet of life saving.

The huge gain in nutrition will keep a hero satiated for at least a few hundred turns, which abuses dexterity - this can be offset by a lot of exercise or a means of restoring lowered stats, e.g. a non-cursed potion of restore ability. The nutrition should also last long enough for the hero to find some lighter sources of permafood, as well as providing a "buffer" for nutrition drain from any spellcasting. Healers in particular always start with the spell of stone to flesh, which can be cast more reliably once they gain some experience levels and allows them to keep well-fed while searching for permafood, so long as they can find boulders.

History

The huge chunk of meat first appears in NetHack 3.3.0 along with the spell of stone to flesh.

Variants

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, huge chunks of meat can be randomly generated, and can be sold in general stores and delicatessens.

Hunger hulks leave behind huge chunks of meat rather than boulders while tunneling.

Encyclopedia entry

See the encyclopedia entry for meatball.

A '''huge chunk of meat''' is a type of [[comestible]] item that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is [[fleshy]] and not [[vegetarian]] or vegan.

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Per {{commit|85099512915a46dde1c813a3fbf56b151dd37fe1}}, the huge chunk of meat is renamed to the '''enormous meatball'''.}}

==Generation==
The huge chunk of meat is not randomly generated, and can only be created by zapping a [[boulder]] with a spell of [[stone to flesh]].

==Description==
When [[eaten]], the huge chunk of meat provides the highest [[nutrition]] value of any comestible in the game at 2000.

==Strategy==
The huge chunk of meat is the heaviest non-[[corpse]] comestible at 400 [[aum]], and will likely make the [[hero]] [[oversatiated]] unless they were fainting beforehand - beware eating '''''anything''''' while oversatiated, as the hero will very likely choke over their food and die, unless they are [[breathless]] or wearing an [[amulet of life saving]].

The huge gain in nutrition will keep a hero satiated for at least a few hundred turns, which [[abuse]]s [[dexterity]] - this can be offset by a lot of [[exercise]] or a means of restoring lowered stats, e.g. a non-cursed [[potion of restore ability]]. The nutrition should also last long enough for the hero to find some lighter sources of permafood, as well as providing a "buffer" for nutrition drain from any [[spellcasting]]. [[Healer]]s in particular always start with the spell of stone to flesh, which can be cast more reliably once they gain some [[experience level]]s and allows them to keep well-fed while searching for permafood, so long as they can find boulders.

==History==
The huge chunk of meat first appears in [[NetHack 3.3.0]] along with the spell of stone to flesh.

==Variants==
===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], huge chunks of meat can be randomly generated, and can be sold in general [[store]]s and delicatessens.

[[Hunger hulk]]s leave behind huge chunks of meat rather than boulders while [[tunnel]]ing.
